biography.bio: Isa Miranda was one of the most significant actresses in Europe from the 1930s-'50s. Her remarkable talent expressed itself both in cinema and theater. She reached international popularity in the 1930s, especially in France, Germany and Austria, and became the only international movie star produced by the fascist cinema. In the 1950s, when her film career began declining, she played on stage in Italy, the US ("Mike McCauley", 1951), France ("Le serpent à sonettes", 1953) and England ("Orpheus Descending" by Tennessee Williams, 1959), receiving positive reviews everywhere. In the 1960s she started a TV career in England, appearing in many made-for-TV movies. She was a versatile actress, exceedingly sensible, a charming woman, and unjustly forgotten at the end of her life even by those who should have remembered her.
biography.name: Isa Miranda

biography.bio: Filippo Scelzo was born on April 19, 1900 in Ivrea, Piedmont, Italy. He was an actor and director, known for Odessa in fiamme (1942), Passaporto rosso (1935) and La bambolona (1968). He died on October 9, 1980 in Rome, Lazio, Italy.
biography.name: Filippo Scelzo

biography.bio: Ugo Ceseri (Florence, 30 June 1893 - Rome, December 3, 1940) was an Italian actor. Born in Florence, he made his debut as a young actor in the theater, in the company of Hermes Novelli, then states with Ruggero Ruggeri, with Andreina Pagnani, Nino Besozzi and Armando Falconi. In 1931, Mario Camerini gives him a small part in the film "Figaro e la sua grande giornata", which will be his entry into the world of film, where he will appear in about 45 films, until the death in 1940.
biography.name: Ugo Ceseri

biography.placeOfBirth: Santa Maria Capua Vetere, Campania, Italy
biography.bio: Giulio Donadio was born on July 5, 1889 in Santa Maria Capua Vetere, Campania, Italy. He was an actor and director, known for L'ispettore Vargas (1940), Passaporto rosso (1935) and La cicala (1919). He died on June 15, 1951 in Rome, Lazio, Italy.
biography.name: Giulio Donadio

biography.bio: Tina Lattanzi was born on December 5, 1897 in Licenza, Lazio, Italy as Annunziata Costantini. She is known for her work on The Leopard (1963), La straniera (1930) and The Unfaithfuls (1953). She died on October 25, 1997 in Milan, Lombardy, Italy.
biography.name: Tina Lattanzi

biography.bio: Federico Collino was born on December 5, 1892 in Florence, Tuscany, Italy. He was an actor, known for Passaporto rosso (1935), Un garibaldien au couvent (1942) and You're on Your Own (1959). He died on July 5, 1975 in Bologna, Emilia-Romagna, Italy.
biography.name: Federico Collino

biography.bio: Olga Pescatori is an actress, known for Passaporto rosso (1935), La damigella di Bard (1938) and Le sorprese del divorzio (1939).
biography.name: Olga Pescatori

biography.bio: Mario Pisu was born on May 21, 1910 in Montecchio Emilia, Italy. He is known for his work on 8½ (1963), Juliet of the Spirits (1965) and The Organizer (1963). He died on July 17, 1976 in Velletri, Italy.
biography.name: Mario Pisu

biography.bio: Oreste Fares was born on January 2, 1885 in Rome, Lazio, Italy. He was an actor, known for Passaporto rosso (1935), The Siege of the Alcazar (1940) and La cavalerie héroïque (1936). He died in 1950.
biography.name: Oreste Fares

biography.bio: Mario Ferrari was born on September 3, 1894 in Rome, Lazio, Italy. He was an actor and writer, known for La dame de tout le monde (1934), L'apôtre du désert (1939) and Nobody's Land (1939). He died on June 28, 1974 in Rome.
biography.name: Mario Ferrari

biography.bio: Carlo Ninchi was born on May 31, 1896 in Bologna, Emilia-Romagna, Italy. He is known for his work on Two Women (1960), Beauty and the Devil (1950) and Odessa in fiamme (1942). He died on April 27, 1974 in Milan, Lombardy, Italy.
biography.name: Carlo Ninchi

biography.bio: Flavio Díaz is an actor, known for Man of the Sea (1942), Passaporto rosso (1935) and La cavalerie héroïque (1936).
biography.name: Flavio Díaz

biography.bio: Guglielmo Barnabò was born on May 11, 1888 in Ancona, Marche, Italy. He was an actor, known for Miracle in Milan (1951), Bread, Love and Dreams (1953) and Scipion l'africain (1937). He was married to Vittorina Benvenuti. He died on May 31, 1954 in Ancona.
biography.name: Guglielmo Barnabò

biography.bio: Guido Verdiani is an actor, known for Tartarino di Tarascona (1960), L'albergo della felicità (1936) and Passaporto rosso (1935).
biography.name: Guido Verdiani

biography.bio: Ernesto Almirante (24 September 1877 - 13 December 1964) was an Italian film and stage actor. Born in Mistretta into a family of actors, Almirante worked several years on stage along his father Nunzio. He was also active as agent and organizer of several stage companies. After an occasional film role in the 1919 mute film "Federica d'Illirio", starting from mid-1930s Almirante became one of the most active character actors of his time. In 1955 he retired from acting and moved into a retirement home for actors in Bologna. He was the uncle of politician Giorgio Almirante.
biography.name: Ernesto Almirante
